Draw two circles centered at (0.375, 0.375) with radii of 0.375 and 0.3068. Exit the sketching environment and set the extrusion depth to 0.1364 units in the direction opposite to the normal. The final shape will be a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The height, width, and length will be approximately 0.75 units. Part 4: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Create a new coordinate system with a translation vector of (0.358, 0, 0.6136). Begin by creating a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Draw an arc with a start point at (0, 0.0004), a mid point at (0.017, 0), and an end point at (0.0341, 0.0004). Draw a line from (0.0341, 0.0004) to (0.0341, 0.0349). Exit the sketching environment and set the extrusion depth to 0.3409 units in the direction opposite to the normal. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. The height, width, and length will be approximately 0.3409, 0.035, and 0.035 units, respectively. Final Shape: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Flat Bottom Assemble Parts 1 through 4 in the following order: 1. Attach Part 1 to the bottom of the coordinate system for Part 4. 2. Attach Part 2 to the top of Part 1. 3. Attach Part 3 to the top of Part 2. 4. Attach Part 4 to the top of Part 3. The final shape will be a cylindrical object with a tapered top and a flat bottom.
